intro: Llavea cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf llavea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
